Hi Scottie et al,
What is the impact of the issue on your business? Unable to scan SQL platform.
Who is affected by this issue? The SQL platform auditors.
What steps have already been taken to troubleshoot the issue? Reviewed job logs and ensured the scan is configured to scan SQL on prem as opposed to SQL online.
What are you trying to do or accomplish? Scan the SQL on prem platform for all user access and object permissions.
Is this a new configuration, data collection, or report? No
If no, has anything changed in your environment since the last time it worked? Upgrade to v.11.6.
When did this issue start?  This week.
What are the steps to reproduce? Run the SQL scan from the job list.
What software is currently installed - run this command from an admin Powershell prompt:
[cid:image001.png@01DB2F13.AC2E9660]

Artifacts attached above from SMP (no AIC logs).
Also attached is job messages log. The job folder itself has been uploaded to the Netwrix ticket portal.
Threads are already set to 10.

Thank you,
Alison.

Hi Stealth,

Thank you for reaching out to Netwrix support regarding your issue. I would be happy to assist you.

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support.

To help us streamline the troubleshooting process and resolve your issue more efficiently, please provide the following information:

What is the impact of the issue on your business?
Who is affected by this issue?
What steps have already been taken to troubleshoot the issue?
What are you trying to do or accomplish?
Is this a new configuration, data collection, or report?
If no, has anything changed in your environment since the last time it worked?
When did this issue start?
What are the steps to reproduce?
What software is currently installed - run this command from an admin Powershell prompt:
Get-CimInstance -Class Win32_Product |Where-Object {($_.Name -Like "Stealth*" -or $_.Name -like "Netwrix*" -or $_.Name -like "Postg*" -or ` $_.Name -like "Python*")} -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Please perform the following steps and upload the resulting Artifacts:

Enable Debug Logging
From the NEA Console > Settings > Application
Set Log Level to Debug
Rerun jobs that are failing to collect logs in full detail. Return Log level to warning afterwards.
[cid:image002.png@01DB2F13.AC2E9660]

Please provide logs from the following locations:
Enterprise Auditor Console: %SAInstallDir%SADatabaseLogsApplication
Access Information Center (11.6): C:Program FilesSTEALTHbitsAccess Information Center
Access Information (11.5): C:inetpubwwwrootStealthAUDIT Compliance

Export of Job(s) – note jobs may be nested under multiple Groups:
Right click on the Job or Job Group experiencing problems and select Export. This creates .zip file containing all logs and configuration settings of your jobs that we can import and review.
[cid:image003.png@01DB2F13.AC2E9660]

From the Job Status Export the Messages Table, CSV is preferred:
[cid:image004.png@01DB2F13.AC2E9660]

Additionally, Can you verify the performance settings for the job and confirm the amount of concurrent threads that are selected? This can be accessed at the location below:

  1.  Right-click on the job and select Properties.
  2.  Navigate to the Performance Tab
  3.  Drop concurrent threads to 10 or lower if they are significantly higher.
I will also connect you with an engineer who is within your region.

Thank you,

Scottie Taylor
Technical Support Engineer

Hi Stealth,

Thank you for reaching out to Netwrix support regarding your issue. I would be happy to assist you.

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support.

To help us streamline the troubleshooting process and resolve your issue more efficiently, please provide the following information:

What is the impact of the issue on your business?
Who is affected by this issue?
What steps have already been taken to troubleshoot the issue?
What are you trying to do or accomplish?
Is this a new configuration, data collection, or report?
If no, has anything changed in your environment since the last time it worked?
When did this issue start?
What are the steps to reproduce?
What software is currently installed - run this command from an admin Powershell prompt:
Get-CimInstance -Class Win32_Product |Where-Object {($_.Name -Like "Stealth*" -or $_.Name -like "Netwrix*" -or $_.Name -like "Postg*" -or ` $_.Name -like "Python*")} -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Please perform the following steps and upload the resulting Artifacts:

Enable Debug Logging
From the NEA Console > Settings > Application
Set Log Level to Debug
Rerun jobs that are failing to collect logs in full detail. Return Log level to warning afterwards.
[cid:image002.png@01DB35ED.EEC68330]

Please provide logs from the following locations:
Enterprise Auditor Console: %SAInstallDir%SADatabaseLogsApplication
Access Information Center (11.6): C:Program FilesSTEALTHbitsAccess Information Center
Access Information (11.5): C:inetpubwwwrootStealthAUDIT Compliance

Export of Job(s) – note jobs may be nested under multiple Groups:
Right click on the Job or Job Group experiencing problems and select Export. This creates .zip file containing all logs and configuration settings of your jobs that we can import and review.
[cid:image003.png@01DB35ED.EEC68330]

From the Job Status Export the Messages Table, CSV is preferred:
[cid:image004.png@01DB35ED.EEC68330]

Additionally, Can you verify the performance settings for the job and confirm the amount of concurrent threads that are selected? This can be accessed at the location below:

  1.  Right-click on the job and select Properties.
  2.  Navigate to the Performance Tab
  3.  Drop concurrent threads to 10 or lower if they are significantly higher.
I will also connect you with an engineer who is within your region.

Thank you,

Scottie Taylor
Technical Support Engineer

Hi Stealth,

Thank you for reaching out to Netwrix support regarding your issue. I would be happy to assist you.

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support.

To help us streamline the troubleshooting process and resolve your issue more efficiently, please provide the following information:

What is the impact of the issue on your business?
Who is affected by this issue?
What steps have already been taken to troubleshoot the issue?
What are you trying to do or accomplish?
Is this a new configuration, data collection, or report?
If no, has anything changed in your environment since the last time it worked?
When did this issue start?
What are the steps to reproduce?
What software is currently installed - run this command from an admin Powershell prompt:
Get-CimInstance -Class Win32_Product |Where-Object {($_.Name -Like "Stealth*" -or $_.Name -like "Netwrix*" -or $_.Name -like "Postg*" -or ` $_.Name -like "Python*")} -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Please perform the following steps and upload the resulting Artifacts:

Enable Debug Logging
From the NEA Console > Settings > Application
Set Log Level to Debug
Rerun jobs that are failing to collect logs in full detail. Return Log level to warning afterwards.
[cid:image002.png@01DB35F0.19988250]

Please provide logs from the following locations:
Enterprise Auditor Console: %SAInstallDir%SADatabaseLogsApplication
Access Information Center (11.6): C:Program FilesSTEALTHbitsAccess Information Center
Access Information (11.5): C:inetpubwwwrootStealthAUDIT Compliance

Export of Job(s) – note jobs may be nested under multiple Groups:
Right click on the Job or Job Group experiencing problems and select Export. This creates .zip file containing all logs and configuration settings of your jobs that we can import and review.
[cid:image003.png@01DB35F0.19988250]

From the Job Status Export the Messages Table, CSV is preferred:
[cid:image004.png@01DB35F0.19988250]

Additionally, Can you verify the performance settings for the job and confirm the amount of concurrent threads that are selected? This can be accessed at the location below:

  1.  Right-click on the job and select Properties.

  3.  Drop concurrent threads to 10 or lower if they are significantly higher.

Scottie Taylor

TextBody:
Kaviya,

Knowing your environment's scale I assume that the root cause is tied to insufficient CPU/RAM. I will provide you links to ALL collectors SQL requirements that should be handed to your DBA Team to provide the necessary computing power.
 
These are dependent upon the size of the target environment. See the following topics for additional:


	
	Active Directory Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	Active Directory Permissions Analyzer Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	AWS Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	Box Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	Databases Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	Entra ID Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	Exchange Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	File System Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	SharePoint Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	Unix Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	Windows Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	

Please refer to the ones you actively use. The requirements are bottom-line, meaning that if one of your collectors (SharePoint or File Server, for example) requires 16 CPU 16 RAM and the other requires 8 CPU 32 RAM, your total should be 16 CPU and 32 RAM (mock numbers, just to explain the logic)

Best wishes,
Ilya Kotov
Technical Support Engineer
1-949-407-5125 x7099
____________________ _________
Cybersecurity That Works for You
 
6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
www.netwrix.com

Kaviya,

Knowing your environment's scale I assume that the root cause is tied to insufficient CPU/RAM. I will provide you links to ALL collectors SQL requirements that should be handed to your DBA Team to provide the necessary computing power.
 
These are dependent upon the size of the target environment. See the following topics for additional:


	
	Active Directory Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	Active Directory Permissions Analyzer Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	AWS Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	Box Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	Databases Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	Entra ID Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	Exchange Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	File System Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	SharePoint Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	Unix Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	
	
	Windows Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	

Please refer to the ones you actively use. The requirements are bottom-line, meaning that if one of your collectors (SharePoint or File Server, for example) requires 16 CPU 16 RAM and the other requires 8 CPU 32 RAM, your total should be 16 CPU and 32 RAM (mock numbers, just to explain the logic)

Best wishes,

Hi Stealth,

Thank you for reaching out to Netwrix support regarding your issue. I would be happy to assist you.

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support. 

To help us streamline the troubleshooting process and resolve your issue more efficiently, please provide the following information:  

What is the impact of the issue on your business? 
Who is affected by this issue? 
What steps have already been taken to troubleshoot the issue? 
What are you trying to do or accomplish? 
Is this a new configuration, data collection, or report? 
If no, has anything changed in your environment since the last time it worked? 
When did this issue start?  
What are the steps to reproduce? 
What software is currently installed - run this command from an admin Powershell prompt:
Get-CimInstance -Class Win32_Product |Where-Object {($_.Name -Like "Stealth*" -or $_.Name -like "Netwrix*" -or $_.Name -like "Postg*" -or ` $_.Name -like "Python*")} -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Please perform the following steps and upload the resulting Artifacts:

Enable Debug Logging
From the NEA Console > Settings > Application
Set Log Level to Debug
Rerun jobs that are failing to collect logs in full detail. Return Log level to warning afterwards.


Please provide logs from the following locations: 
Enterprise Auditor Console: %SAInstallDir%SADatabaseLogsApplication 
Access Information Center (11.6): C:Program FilesSTEALTHbitsAccess Information Center 
Access Information (11.5): C:inetpubwwwrootStealthAUDIT Compliance 

Export of Job(s) – note jobs may be nested under multiple Groups:
Right click on the Job or Job Group experiencing problems and select Export. This creates .zip file containing all logs and configuration settings of your jobs that we can import and review.


From the Job Status Export the Messages Table, CSV is preferred: 
 

Additionally, Can you verify the performance settings for the job and confirm the amount of concurrent threads that are selected? This can be accessed at the location below: 


	Right-click on the job and select Properties. 
	Navigate to the Performance Tab
	Drop concurrent threads to 10 or lower if they are significantly higher.


I will also connect you with an engineer who is within your region.

Thank you,

Scottie Taylor
Technical Support Engineer

Hi Stealth,

Thank you for reaching out to Netwrix support regarding your issue. I would be happy to assist you.

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support.

To help us streamline the troubleshooting process and resolve your issue more efficiently, please provide the following information:

What is the impact of the issue on your business?
Who is affected by this issue?
What steps have already been taken to troubleshoot the issue?
What are you trying to do or accomplish?
Is this a new configuration, data collection, or report?
If no, has anything changed in your environment since the last time it worked?
When did this issue start?
What are the steps to reproduce?
What software is currently installed - run this command from an admin Powershell prompt:
Get-CimInstance -Class Win32_Product |Where-Object {($_.Name -Like "Stealth*" -or $_.Name -like "Netwrix*" -or $_.Name -like "Postg*" -or ` $_.Name -like "Python*")} -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Please perform the following steps and upload the resulting Artifacts:

Enable Debug Logging
From the NEA Console > Settings > Application
Set Log Level to Debug
Rerun jobs that are failing to collect logs in full detail. Return Log level to warning afterwards.
[cid:image002.png@01DB3788.5632C790]

Please provide logs from the following locations:
Enterprise Auditor Console: %SAInstallDir%SADatabaseLogsApplication
Access Information Center (11.6): C:Program FilesSTEALTHbitsAccess Information Center
Access Information (11.5): C:inetpubwwwrootStealthAUDIT Compliance

Export of Job(s) – note jobs may be nested under multiple Groups:
Right click on the Job or Job Group experiencing problems and select Export. This creates .zip file containing all logs and configuration settings of your jobs that we can import and review.
[cid:image003.png@01DB3788.5632C790]

From the Job Status Export the Messages Table, CSV is preferred:
[cid:image004.png@01DB3788.5632C790]

Additionally, Can you verify the performance settings for the job and confirm the amount of concurrent threads that are selected? This can be accessed at the location below:

  1.  Right-click on the job and select Properties.
  2.  Navigate to the Performance Tab
  3.  Drop concurrent threads to 10 or lower if they are significantly higher.
I will also connect you with an engineer who is within your region.

Thank you,

Scottie Taylor
Technical Support Engineer

Kaviya,

Knowing your environment's scale I assume that the root cause is tied to insufficient CPU/RAM. I will provide you links to ALL collectors SQL requirements that should be handed to your DBA Team to provide the necessary computing power.
 

These are dependent upon the size of the target environment. See the following topics for additional:


	Active Directory Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Active Directory Permissions Analyzer Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	AWS Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Box Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Databases Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Entra ID Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Exchange Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	File System Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	SharePoint Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Unix Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Windows Solution Requirements on the SQL Server


Please refer to the ones you actively use. The requirements are bottom-line, meaning that if one of your collectors (SharePoint or File Server, for example) requires 16 CPU 16 RAM and the other requires 8 CPU 32 RAM, your total should be 16 CPU and 32 RAM (mock numbers, just to explain the logic)

Best wishes,
Ilya Kotov
Technical Support Engineer
1-949-407-5125 x7099

Hi Stealth,

What software is currently installed - run this command from an admin Powershell prompt:
Get-CimInstance -Class Win32_Product |Where-Object {($_.Name -Like "Stealth*" -or $_.Name -like "Netwrix*" -or $_.Name -like "Postg*" -or ` $_.Name -like "Python*")} -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Please perform the following steps and upload the resulting Artifacts:

Enable Debug Logging

Set Log Level to Debug
Rerun jobs that are failing to collect logs in full detail. Return Log level to warning afterwards.

Enterprise Auditor Console: %SAInstallDir%SADatabaseLogsApplication 
Access Information Center (11.6): C:Program FilesSTEALTHbitsAccess Information Center

Export of Job(s) – note jobs may be nested under multiple Groups:
Right click on the Job or Job Group experiencing problems and select Export. This creates .zip file containing all logs and configuration settings of your jobs that we can import and review.

Additionally, Can you verify the performance settings for the job and confirm the amount of concurrent threads that are selected? This can be accessed at the location below:

Kaviya,

Knowing your environment's scale I assume that the root cause is tied to insufficient CPU/RAM. I will provide you links to ALL collectors SQL requirements that should be handed to your DBA Team to provide the necessary computing power.
 

These are dependent upon the size of the target environment. See the following topics for additional:


	Active Directory Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Active Directory Permissions Analyzer Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	AWS Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Box Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Databases Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Entra ID Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Exchange Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	File System Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	SharePoint Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Unix Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Windows Solution Requirements on the SQL Server


Please refer to the ones you actively use. The requirements are bottom-line, meaning that if one of your collectors (SharePoint or File Server, for example) requires 16 CPU 16 RAM and the other requires 8 CPU 32 RAM, your total should be 16 CPU and 32 RAM (mock numbers, just to explain the logic)

Best wishes,
Ilya Kotov
Technical Support Engineer
1-949-407-5125 x7099

Hi Scottie et al,
What is the impact of the issue on your business? Unable to scan SQL platform.
Who is affected by this issue? The SQL platform auditors.
What steps have already been taken to troubleshoot the issue? Reviewed job logs and ensured the scan is configured to scan SQL on prem as opposed to SQL online.
What are you trying to do or accomplish? Scan the SQL on prem platform for all user access and object permissions.
Is this a new configuration, data collection, or report? No
If no, has anything changed in your environment since the last time it worked? Upgrade to v.11.6.
When did this issue start?  This week.
What are the steps to reproduce? Run the SQL scan from the job list.

[cid:image001.png@01DB3B51.13140330]

Kaviya,

Knowing your environment's scale I assume that the root cause is tied to insufficient CPU/RAM. I will provide you links to ALL collectors SQL requirements that should be handed to your DBA Team to provide the necessary computing power.
 

These are dependent upon the size of the target environment. See the following topics for additional:


	Active Directory Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Active Directory Permissions Analyzer Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	AWS Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Box Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Databases Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Entra ID Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Exchange Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	File System Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	SharePoint Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Unix Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Windows Solution Requirements on the SQL Server


Please refer to the ones you actively use. The requirements are bottom-line, meaning that if one of your collectors (SharePoint or File Server, for example) requires 16 CPU 16 RAM and the other requires 8 CPU 32 RAM, your total should be 16 CPU and 32 RAM (mock numbers, just to explain the logic)

Best wishes,
Ilya Kotov
Technical Support Engineer

Kaviya,

Knowing your environment's scale I assume that the root cause is tied to insufficient CPU/RAM. I will provide you links to ALL collectors SQL requirements that should be handed to your DBA Team to provide the necessary computing power.
 

These are dependent upon the size of the target environment. See the following topics for additional:


	Active Directory Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Active Directory Permissions Analyzer Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	AWS Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Box Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Databases Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Entra ID Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Exchange Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	File System Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	SharePoint Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Unix Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Windows Solution Requirements on the SQL Server


Please refer to the ones you actively use. The requirements are bottom-line, meaning that if one of your collectors (SharePoint or File Server, for example) requires 16 CPU 16 RAM and the other requires 8 CPU 32 RAM, your total should be 16 CPU and 32 RAM (mock numbers, just to explain the logic)

Best wishes,
Ilya Kotov
Technical Support Engineer
1-949-407-5125 x7099

Enterprise Auditor Console: %SAInstallDir%SADatabaseLogsApplication

Export of Job(s) – note jobs may be nested under multiple Groups:
Right click on the Job or Job Group experiencing problems and select Export. This creates .zip file containing all logs and configuration settings of your jobs that we can import and review.


From the Job Status Export the Messages Table, CSV is preferred: 
 

Additionally, Can you verify the performance settings for the job and confirm the amount of concurrent threads that are selected? This can be accessed at the location below: 


	Right-click on the job and select Properties. 
	Navigate to the Performance Tab
	Drop concurrent threads to 10 or lower if they are significantly higher.


I will also connect you with an engineer who is within your region.

Hi Stealth,

Thank you for reaching out to Netwrix support regarding your issue. I would be happy to assist you.

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support.

To help us streamline the troubleshooting process and resolve your issue more efficiently, please provide the following information:

What is the impact of the issue on your business?
Who is affected by this issue?
What steps have already been taken to troubleshoot the issue?
What are you trying to do or accomplish?
Is this a new configuration, data collection, or report?
If no, has anything changed in your environment since the last time it worked?
When did this issue start?
What are the steps to reproduce?
What software is currently installed - run this command from an admin Powershell prompt:
Get-CimInstance -Class Win32_Product |Where-Object {($_.Name -Like "Stealth*" -or $_.Name -like "Netwrix*" -or $_.Name -like "Postg*" -or ` $_.Name -like "Python*")} -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Please perform the following steps and upload the resulting Artifacts:

Enable Debug Logging
From the NEA Console > Settings > Application
Set Log Level to Debug
Rerun jobs that are failing to collect logs in full detail. Return Log level to warning afterwards.
[cid:image004.png@01DB3C2E.6EF20AC0]

Please provide logs from the following locations:
Enterprise Auditor Console: %SAInstallDir%SADatabaseLogsApplication
Access Information Center (11.6): C:Program FilesSTEALTHbitsAccess Information Center
Access Information (11.5): C:inetpubwwwrootStealthAUDIT Compliance

Export of Job(s) – note jobs may be nested under multiple Groups:
Right click on the Job or Job Group experiencing problems and select Export. This creates .zip file containing all logs and configuration settings of your jobs that we can import and review.
[cid:image005.png@01DB3C2E.6EF20AC0]

From the Job Status Export the Messages Table, CSV is preferred:
[cid:image006.png@01DB3C2E.6EF20AC0]

Additionally, Can you verify the performance settings for the job and confirm the amount of concurrent threads that are selected? This can be accessed at the location below:

  1.  Right-click on the job and select Properties.
  2.  Navigate to the Performance Tab
  3.  Drop concurrent threads to 10 or lower if they are significantly higher.
I will also connect you with an engineer who is within your region.

Thank you,

Scottie Taylor
Technical Support Engineer

Kaviya,

Knowing your environment's scale I assume that the root cause is tied to insufficient CPU/RAM. I will provide you links to ALL collectors SQL requirements that should be handed to your DBA Team to provide the necessary computing power.
 

These are dependent upon the size of the target environment. See the following topics for additional:


	Active Directory Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Active Directory Permissions Analyzer Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	AWS Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Box Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Databases Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Entra ID Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Exchange Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	File System Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	SharePoint Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Unix Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Windows Solution Requirements on the SQL Server


Please refer to the ones you actively use. The requirements are bottom-line, meaning that if one of your collectors (SharePoint or File Server, for example) requires 16 CPU 16 RAM and the other requires 8 CPU 32 RAM, your total should be 16 CPU and 32 RAM (mock numbers, just to explain the logic)

Best wishes,
Ilya Kotov
Technical Support Engineer
1-949-407-5125 x7099

Hi Stealth,

Thank you for reaching out to Netwrix support regarding your issue. I would be happy to assist you.

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support. 

To help us streamline the troubleshooting process and resolve your issue more efficiently, please provide the following information:  

What is the impact of the issue on your business? 
Who is affected by this issue? 
What steps have already been taken to troubleshoot the issue? 
What are you trying to do or accomplish? 
Is this a new configuration, data collection, or report? 
If no, has anything changed in your environment since the last time it worked? 
When did this issue start?  
What are the steps to reproduce? 
What software is currently installed - run this command from an admin Powershell prompt:
Get-CimInstance -Class Win32_Product |Where-Object {($_.Name -Like "Stealth*" -or $_.Name -like "Netwrix*" -or $_.Name -like "Postg*" -or ` $_.Name -like "Python*")} -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Please perform the following steps and upload the resulting Artifacts:

Enable Debug Logging
From the NEA Console > Settings > Application
Set Log Level to Debug
Rerun jobs that are failing to collect logs in full detail. Return Log level to warning afterwards.


Please provide logs from the following locations: 
Enterprise Auditor Console: %SAInstallDir%SADatabaseLogsApplication 
Access Information Center (11.6): C:Program FilesSTEALTHbitsAccess Information Center 
Access Information (11.5): C:inetpubwwwrootStealthAUDIT Compliance 

Export of Job(s) – note jobs may be nested under multiple Groups:
Right click on the Job or Job Group experiencing problems and select Export. This creates .zip file containing all logs and configuration settings of your jobs that we can import and review.


From the Job Status Export the Messages Table, CSV is preferred: 
 

Additionally, Can you verify the performance settings for the job and confirm the amount of concurrent threads that are selected? This can be accessed at the location below: 


	Right-click on the job and select Properties. 
	Navigate to the Performance Tab
	Drop concurrent threads to 10 or lower if they are significantly higher.


I will also connect you with an engineer who is within your region.

Thank you,

Scottie Taylor

Kaviya,

Knowing your environment's scale I assume that the root cause is tied to insufficient CPU/RAM. I will provide you links to ALL collectors SQL requirements that should be handed to your DBA Team to provide the necessary computing power.
 

These are dependent upon the size of the target environment. See the following topics for additional:


	Active Directory Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Active Directory Permissions Analyzer Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	AWS Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Box Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Databases Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Entra ID Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Exchange Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	File System Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	SharePoint Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Unix Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Windows Solution Requirements on the SQL Server


Please refer to the ones you actively use. The requirements are bottom-line, meaning that if one of your collectors (SharePoint or File Server, for example) requires 16 CPU 16 RAM and the other requires 8 CPU 32 RAM, your total should be 16 CPU and 32 RAM (mock numbers, just to explain the logic)

Best wishes,
Ilya Kotov
Technical Support Engineer
1-949-407-5125 x7099

Hi Stealth,

Thank you for reaching out to Netwrix support regarding your issue. I would be happy to assist you.

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support.

To help us streamline the troubleshooting process and resolve your issue more efficiently, please provide the following information:

What is the impact of the issue on your business?
Who is affected by this issue?
What steps have already been taken to troubleshoot the issue?
What are you trying to do or accomplish?
Is this a new configuration, data collection, or report?
If no, has anything changed in your environment since the last time it worked?
When did this issue start?
What are the steps to reproduce?
What software is currently installed - run this command from an admin Powershell prompt:
Get-CimInstance -Class Win32_Product |Where-Object {($_.Name -Like "Stealth*" -or $_.Name -like "Netwrix*" -or $_.Name -like "Postg*" -or ` $_.Name -like "Python*")} -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Please perform the following steps and upload the resulting Artifacts:

Enable Debug Logging
From the NEA Console > Settings > Application
Set Log Level to Debug
Rerun jobs that are failing to collect logs in full detail. Return Log level to warning afterwards.
[cid:image004.png@01DB3F7B.22832930]

Please provide logs from the following locations:
Enterprise Auditor Console: %SAInstallDir%SADatabaseLogsApplication
Access Information Center (11.6): C:Program FilesSTEALTHbitsAccess Information Center
Access Information (11.5): C:inetpubwwwrootStealthAUDIT Compliance

Export of Job(s) – note jobs may be nested under multiple Groups:
Right click on the Job or Job Group experiencing problems and select Export. This creates .zip file containing all logs and configuration settings of your jobs that we can import and review.
[cid:image005.png@01DB3F7B.22832930]

From the Job Status Export the Messages Table, CSV is preferred:
[cid:image006.png@01DB3F7B.22832930]

Additionally, Can you verify the performance settings for the job and confirm the amount of concurrent threads that are selected? This can be accessed at the location below:

  1.  Right-click on the job and select Properties.
  2.  Navigate to the Performance Tab
  3.  Drop concurrent threads to 10 or lower if they are significantly higher.
I will also connect you with an engineer who is within your region.

Thank you,

Scottie Taylor
Technical Support Engineer

Kaviya,

Knowing your environment's scale I assume that the root cause is tied to insufficient CPU/RAM. I will provide you links to ALL collectors SQL requirements that should be handed to your DBA Team to provide the necessary computing power.
 

These are dependent upon the size of the target environment. See the following topics for additional:


	Active Directory Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Active Directory Permissions Analyzer Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	AWS Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Box Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Databases Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Entra ID Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Exchange Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	File System Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	SharePoint Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Unix Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Windows Solution Requirements on the SQL Server


Please refer to the ones you actively use. The requirements are bottom-line, meaning that if one of your collectors (SharePoint or File Server, for example) requires 16 CPU 16 RAM and the other requires 8 CPU 32 RAM, your total should be 16 CPU and 32 RAM (mock numbers, just to explain the logic)

Best wishes,
Ilya Kotov

Hi Stealth,

Thank you for reaching out to Netwrix support regarding your issue. I would be happy to assist you.

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support. 

To help us streamline the troubleshooting process and resolve your issue more efficiently, please provide the following information:  

What is the impact of the issue on your business? 
Who is affected by this issue? 
What steps have already been taken to troubleshoot the issue? 
What are you trying to do or accomplish? 
Is this a new configuration, data collection, or report? 
If no, has anything changed in your environment since the last time it worked? 
When did this issue start?  
What are the steps to reproduce? 
What software is currently installed - run this command from an admin Powershell prompt:
Get-CimInstance -Class Win32_Product |Where-Object {($_.Name -Like "Stealth*" -or $_.Name -like "Netwrix*" -or $_.Name -like "Postg*" -or ` $_.Name -like "Python*")} -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Please perform the following steps and upload the resulting Artifacts:

Enable Debug Logging
From the NEA Console > Settings > Application
Set Log Level to Debug
Rerun jobs that are failing to collect logs in full detail. Return Log level to warning afterwards.


Please provide logs from the following locations: 
Enterprise Auditor Console: %SAInstallDir%SADatabaseLogsApplication 
Access Information Center (11.6): C:Program FilesSTEALTHbitsAccess Information Center 
Access Information (11.5): C:inetpubwwwrootStealthAUDIT Compliance 

Export of Job(s) – note jobs may be nested under multiple Groups:
Right click on the Job or Job Group experiencing problems and select Export. This creates .zip file containing all logs and configuration settings of your jobs that we can import and review.


From the Job Status Export the Messages Table, CSV is preferred: 
 

Additionally, Can you verify the performance settings for the job and confirm the amount of concurrent threads that are selected? This can be accessed at the location below: 


	Right-click on the job and select Properties. 
	Navigate to the Performance Tab
	Drop concurrent threads to 10 or lower if they are significantly higher.


I will also connect you with an engineer who is within your region.

Thank you,

Scottie Taylor

Hi Stealth,

Thank you for reaching out to Netwrix support regarding your issue. I would be happy to assist you.

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support.

To help us streamline the troubleshooting process and resolve your issue more efficiently, please provide the following information:

What is the impact of the issue on your business?
Who is affected by this issue?
What steps have already been taken to troubleshoot the issue?
What are you trying to do or accomplish?
Is this a new configuration, data collection, or report?
If no, has anything changed in your environment since the last time it worked?
When did this issue start?
What are the steps to reproduce?
What software is currently installed - run this command from an admin Powershell prompt:
Get-CimInstance -Class Win32_Product |Where-Object {($_.Name -Like "Stealth*" -or $_.Name -like "Netwrix*" -or $_.Name -like "Postg*" -or ` $_.Name -like "Python*")} -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Please perform the following steps and upload the resulting Artifacts:

Enable Debug Logging
From the NEA Console > Settings > Application
Set Log Level to Debug
Rerun jobs that are failing to collect logs in full detail. Return Log level to warning afterwards.
[cid:image004.png@01DB4109.BFA45290]

Please provide logs from the following locations:
Enterprise Auditor Console: %SAInstallDir%SADatabaseLogsApplication
Access Information Center (11.6): C:Program FilesSTEALTHbitsAccess Information Center
Access Information (11.5): C:inetpubwwwrootStealthAUDIT Compliance

Export of Job(s) – note jobs may be nested under multiple Groups:
Right click on the Job or Job Group experiencing problems and select Export. This creates .zip file containing all logs and configuration settings of your jobs that we can import and review.
[cid:image005.png@01DB4109.BFA45290]

From the Job Status Export the Messages Table, CSV is preferred:
[cid:image006.png@01DB4109.BFA45290]

Additionally, Can you verify the performance settings for the job and confirm the amount of concurrent threads that are selected? This can be accessed at the location below:

  1.  Right-click on the job and select Properties.
  2.  Navigate to the Performance Tab
  3.  Drop concurrent threads to 10 or lower if they are significantly higher.
I will also connect you with an engineer who is within your region.

Thank you,

Scottie Taylor

Kaviya,

Knowing your environment's scale I assume that the root cause is tied to insufficient CPU/RAM. I will provide you links to ALL collectors SQL requirements that should be handed to your DBA Team to provide the necessary computing power.
 

These are dependent upon the size of the target environment. See the following topics for additional:


	Active Directory Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Active Directory Permissions Analyzer Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	AWS Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Box Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Databases Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Entra ID Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Exchange Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	File System Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	SharePoint Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Unix Solution Requirements on the SQL Server
	Windows Solution Requirements on the SQL Server


Please refer to the ones you actively use. The requirements are bottom-line, meaning that if one of your collectors (SharePoint or File Server, for example) requires 16 CPU 16 RAM and the other requires 8 CPU 32 RAM, your total should be 16 CPU and 32 RAM (mock numbers, just to explain the logic)

Best wishes,
Ilya Kotov
Technical Support Engineer
1-949-407-5125 x7099

Hi Stealth,

Thank you for reaching out to Netwrix support regarding your issue. I would be happy to assist you.

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support. 

To help us streamline the troubleshooting process and resolve your issue more efficiently, please provide the following information:  

What is the impact of the issue on your business? 
Who is affected by this issue? 
What steps have already been taken to troubleshoot the issue? 
What are you trying to do or accomplish? 
Is this a new configuration, data collection, or report? 
If no, has anything changed in your environment since the last time it worked? 
When did this issue start?  
What are the steps to reproduce? 
What software is currently installed - run this command from an admin Powershell prompt:
Get-CimInstance -Class Win32_Product |Where-Object {($_.Name -Like "Stealth*" -or $_.Name -like "Netwrix*" -or $_.Name -like "Postg*" -or ` $_.Name -like "Python*")} -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Please perform the following steps and upload the resulting Artifacts:

Enable Debug Logging
From the NEA Console > Settings > Application
Set Log Level to Debug
Rerun jobs that are failing to collect logs in full detail. Return Log level to warning afterwards.


Please provide logs from the following locations: 
Enterprise Auditor Console: %SAInstallDir%SADatabaseLogsApplication 
Access Information Center (11.6): C:Program FilesSTEALTHbitsAccess Information Center 
Access Information (11.5): C:inetpubwwwrootStealthAUDIT Compliance 

Export of Job(s) – note jobs may be nested under multiple Groups:
Right click on the Job or Job Group experiencing problems and select Export. This creates .zip file containing all logs and configuration settings of your jobs that we can import and review.


From the Job Status Export the Messages Table, CSV is preferred: 
 

Additionally, Can you verify the performance settings for the job and confirm the amount of concurrent threads that are selected? This can be accessed at the location below: 


	Right-click on the job and select Properties. 
	Navigate to the Performance Tab
	Drop concurrent threads to 10 or lower if they are significantly higher.


I will also connect you with an engineer who is within your region.

Thank you,

Scottie Taylor
